headline: Why Strategy Stock May Never Make It Into the S&P 500
summary: Strategy missed the cut for admission into the S&P 500 Friday when three additions were announced—  AppLovin Robinhood Markets  and  Emcor  —and it could be tough for the big Bitcoin holder to be chosen.  The company looks more like an exchange-traded fund or closed-end fund than an operating company with ample recurring revenue and profits.  The company’s strategy is to issue equity—mostly common stock and some preferred—and buy Bitcoin, making it a giant repository of the cryptocurrency.

raw.headline: Why Strategy Stock May Never Make It Into the S&P 500
raw.summary: Strategy missed the cut for admission into the S&P 500 Friday when three additions were announced—  AppLovin Robinhood Markets  and  Emcor  —and it could be tough for the big Bitcoin holder to be chosen.  The company looks more like an exchange-traded fund or closed-end fund than an operating company with ample recurring revenue and profits.  The company’s strategy is to issue equity—mostly common stock and some preferred—and buy Bitcoin, making it a giant repository of the cryptocurrency.

headline: Robinhood joining S&P 500, Broadcom & OpenAI, Duolingo coverage
summary: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including the addition of Robinhood Markets (HOOD), Applovin (APP), and EMCOR (EME) to the S&P 500 (^GSPC) starting September 22; Broadcom (AVGO) inking a $10 billion AI chip deal with OpenAI; and Wells Fargo initiating coverage on Duolingo stock (DUOL). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Strategy Stock Drops on S&P 500 Snub. It’s Still a Buy, Analyst Says.
summary: Shares of  Strategy  were falling Monday after the  Bitcoin  -treasury pioneer missed out on inclusion in the  dashing hopes that would trigger a flow of investments from funds seeking to match the index’s performance.  While Strategy, formerly known as  MicroStrategy  posted a profit last quarter, clearing the final hurdle required for potential inclusion, it didn’t make the cut.  The decision won’t have come as a shock to seasoned investors, and it shouldn’t discourage those who have bet on the buzzy cryptocurrency company, argued Benchmark’s Mark Palmer, a longtime fan of the stock.

raw.headline: Strategy Stock Drops on S&P 500 Snub. It’s Still a Buy, Analyst Says.
raw.summary: Shares of  Strategy  were falling Monday after the  Bitcoin  -treasury pioneer missed out on inclusion in the  dashing hopes that would trigger a flow of investments from funds seeking to match the index’s performance.  While Strategy, formerly known as  MicroStrategy  posted a profit last quarter, clearing the final hurdle required for potential inclusion, it didn’t make the cut.  The decision won’t have come as a shock to seasoned investors, and it shouldn’t discourage those who have bet on the buzzy cryptocurrency company, argued Benchmark’s Mark Palmer, a longtime fan of the stock.

headline: Stocks tick higher as Wall Street drifts near its record levels
summary: Stocks are ticking higher on Monday, ahead of a week with several data reports that could dictate by how much or even whether the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates at its next meeting in a week.  The S&P 500 rose 0.3% and was sitting just below its record set last week.  AppLovin and Robinhood Markets helped lead the market after learning they will join the S&P 500 index later this month, along with Emcor Group.
